attributes.action: restore specialist maternity services to Huddersfield Royal Infirmary.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Huddersfield's consultant led & specialist maternity services closed in August 2008.
Mums now have to be taken to Calderdale if there are complications during birth.
There's a new midwife led unit at the Huddersfield Royal Infirmary but we want specialist and emergency care available too.

This petition is inspired by the memory of Maisie.
 
"A BABY girl would have survived if she had been born in Huddersfield not Halifax, her parents say.

Alanna Delahaye and Glynn Bates, of Coombe Road, Golcar, say daughter Maisie would have lived if full maternity services were still open at Huddersfield Royal Infirmary.

Instead Alanna was driven the extra five-and-a-half miles to the Calderdale Royal Hospital in Halifax where Maisie was born through emergency Caesarean section.

She was not breathing when she was delivered, but doctors managed to revive her.

But she was left severely brain- damaged because her umbilical cord had been wrapped tightly around her and had cut off oxygen to her brain.

The couple were told Maisie was likely to die within a few days.

They took the heartbreaking decision to take her off life-support three days later."

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to restore specialist maternity services to Huddersfield Royal Infirmary.

Her Majesty's Government has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.hmg.gov.uk/epetition-responses/petition-view.aspx?epref=HRIMums


Her Majesty's Government
